snippet: The lethal conflict between Egypt’s military-backed government and its Islamist opponents grew on Monday, with an expansion of attacks against government targets.
abstract: Lethal conflict between Egypt’s military-backed government and its Islamist opponents is escalating, with an expansion of attacks against government targets, signs that authorities have failed to secure streets and that both sides refuse to back down; three brazen attacks across the country killing several soldiers and police officers come a day after security forces killed 53 protesters in Cairo.
lead_paragraph: The lethal conflict between Egypt’s military-backed government and its Islamist opponents grew on Monday, with an expansion of attacks against government targets.

headline.main: Egyptian Attacks Are Escalating Amid Stalemate
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Attacks Are Escalating Amid Stalemate

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
